intro: Nardurus tuberculosus, commonly known as the tuberculate nardus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland fynbos vegetation. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
